intro: Allenanthus hondurensis, commonly known as the Honduran Allenanthus, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer seasons. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette. Allenanthus hondurensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
